title: Unaccounted Gold:Government Likely To Fix Holding Limit, Announce 'Amnesty' Scheme For Unaccounted Gold
text:
In an attempt to crack down on black money and unaccounted gold, the government is planning to set a holding limit for the yellow metal.

The PMO and the Finance Ministry are giving finishing touches to a scheme aimed at legalizing unaccounted wealth in gold, CNBC reported.

BCCL

According to the report, individuals be allowed to disclose unaccounted gold (gold without receipt) beyond a certain threshold and pay taxes on the disclosed value.

Additionally, there is also a proposal to set up a ‘Gold Board’ with representatives from the government and private sector most likely this fiscal and will annually tweak proposals to keep the schemes attractive for buyers and develop gold holdings into a financial asset.

Gold has always found a high demand in India. In 2017 Indians purchased 771 tonnes of the yellow metal and in 2018 was 760 tonnes.

It has a central role in the country’s culture, considered a store of value, a symbol of wealth and status and a fundamental part of many rituals.

Many also buy gold as a safe investment as the prices have remained high for a long time and is likely to remain the same way.

BCCL

Cracking down on unaccounted gold holdings is the second major step taken by the Modi government to fight black money after the demonetization which was announced in November 2016.

After demonetisation, the government had increased scrutiny of cash transactions, banning those above Rs 2 lakh and reporting of PAN for any transaction of Rs 50,000 or above.
